page.title: 18ESCLEY BROOK.
page.content: The Escley is a{small brook}which runs through Michaelchurch Escley helping to give the village its name. It starts up on{Vagar Hill}and feeds into {The Monnow,}which in turn leads into {The Wye}and eventually the{Severn } {Estuary.} The fishing rights through Michaelchurch are mainly owned by Mr.Hunter. Local fishermen find it a {good trout stream.} It is crossed in 2 places by old stone bridges. The bridge by the Post Office is built on the site of an old ford. In the Michaelchurch area,in days gone past,this brook powered{two {mills}and you can still see the old weirs and mill races.
